name: DatastoreClient
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
V1
DatastoreClient
description: Each RPC normalizes the partition IDs of the keys in its input entities, and always returns entities with keys with normalized partition IDs. This applies to all keys and entities, including those in values, except keys with both an empty path and an empty or unset partition ID. Normalization of input keys sets the project ID (if not already set) to the project ID from the request.

params.name: credentials
params.description: Provides the means for authenticating requests made by the client. This parameter can be many types. A Google::Auth::Credentials uses a the properties of its represented keyfile for authenticating requests made by this client. A String will be treated as the path to the keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A Hash will be treated as the contents of a keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A GRPC::Core::Channel will be used to make calls through. A GRPC::Core::ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client. The channel credentials should already be composed with a GRPC::Core::CallCredentials object. A Proc will be used as an updater_proc for the Grpc channel. The proc transforms the metadata for requests, generally, to give OAuth credentials.

params.name: scopes
params.description:
The OAuth scopes for this service. This parameter is ignored if
an updater_proc is supplied.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

params.name: metadata
params.description: Default metadata to be sent with each request. This can be overridden on a per call basis.

params.name: exception_transformer
params.description:
An optional proc that intercepts any exceptions raised during an API call to inject
custom error handling.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore_client = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +keys+:
keys = []
response = datastore_client.lookup(project_id, keys)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: keys
params.description: Keys of entities to look up. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::Key can also be provided.

params.name: read_options
params.description: The options for this lookup request. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::ReadOptions can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore_client = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +partition_id+:
partition_id = {}
response = datastore_client.run_query(project_id, partition_id)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: partition_id
params.description: Entities are partitioned into subsets, identified by a partition ID. Queries are scoped to a single partition. This partition ID is normalized with the standard default context partition ID. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::PartitionId can also be provided.

params.name: read_options
params.description: The options for this query. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::ReadOptions can also be provided.

params.name: query
params.description: The query to run. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::Query can also be provided.

params.name: gql_query
params.description: The GQL query to run. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::GqlQuery can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore_client = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''
response = datastore_client.begin_transaction(project_id)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: transaction_options
params.description: Options for a new transaction. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::TransactionOptions can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: commit
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
V1
DatastoreClient#commit
methods.description: Commits a transaction, optionally creating, deleting or modifying some entities.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore_client = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +mode+:
mode = :MODE_UNSPECIFIED

# TODO: Initialize +mutations+:
mutations = []
response = datastore_client.commit(project_id, mode, mutations)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: mode
params.description: The type of commit to perform. Defaults to +TRANSACTIONAL+.

params.name: mutations
params.description:
The mutations to perform.

When mode is +TRANSACTIONAL+, mutations affecting a single entity are applied in order. The following sequences of mutations affecting a single entity are not permitted in a single +Commit+ request:

  • +insert+ followed by +insert+
  • +update+ followed by +insert+
  • +upsert+ followed by +insert+
  • +delete+ followed by +update+

When mode is +NON_TRANSACTIONAL+, no two mutations may affect a single entity. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::Mutation can also be provided.

params.name: transaction
params.description:
The identifier of the transaction associated with the commit. A
transaction identifier is returned by a call to
Google::Datastore::V1::Datastore::BeginTransaction.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore_client = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +transaction+:
transaction = ''
response = datastore_client.rollback(project_id, transaction)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: transaction
params.description:
The transaction identifier, returned by a call to
Google::Datastore::V1::Datastore::BeginTransaction.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: allocate_ids
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
V1
DatastoreClient#allocate_ids
methods.description: Allocates IDs for the given keys, which is useful for referencing an entity before it is inserted.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore_client = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +keys+:
keys = []
response = datastore_client.allocate_ids(project_id, keys)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: keys
params.description: A list of keys with incomplete key paths for which to allocate IDs. No key may be reserved/read-only. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::Key can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: reserve_ids
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
V1
DatastoreClient#reserve_ids
methods.description: Prevents the supplied keysâ€™ IDs from being auto-allocated by Cloud Datastore.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore_client = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new(version: :v1)

# TODO: Initialize +project_id+:
project_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +keys+:
keys = []
response = datastore_client.reserve_ids(project_id, keys)

params.name: project_id
params.description: The ID of the project against which to make the request.

params.name: keys
params.description: A list of keys with complete key paths whose numeric IDs should not be auto-allocated. A hash of the same form as Google::Datastore::V1::Key can also be provided.

params.name: database_id
params.description: If not empty, the ID of the database against which to make the request.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation
